com.worizon.jsonrpc

Class JsonRpcResponse<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.worizon.jsonrpc.JsonRpcBase
      • com.worizon.jsonrpc.JsonRpcResponse<T>

  • public class JsonRpcResponse<T>
extends JsonRpcBase
    This class represents a JSON-RPC response. The generic parameter T is the type of the expected output of the remote procedure. For instance, JsonRpcResponse<Integer> is the response object of a remote procedure returning an integer. Not only this class can be parameterized with primitive types but also with custom types, ex: JsonRpcResponse<Dummy>.

    All JsonRpcResponse MUST come with one and only one of the fields error or results filled. A server response having none of these or both of them will throw a JsonRpcException.

    If an error happens, on the remote procedure or along the way to the remote procedure, the error object will be non-null and the result object will be null, otherwise the result object will be non-null.

    Example of two JSON-RPC response strings, error and non-error situation: 

       
 {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "error": {"code": -32601, "message": "Method not found."}, "id": 188329}
 
 {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "result": 19, "id": 177784}
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Enric Cecilla

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonRpcResponse

        public JsonRpcResponse(String jsonStr,
               Class<? extends T> clazz)
        Crates a JsonRpcResponse object.
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - The JSON-RPC response string from the server.
        clazz - The type that the result object will be converted to.
        Throws:
        JsonRpcException - when the jsonrpc field in the response is different from "2.0".
        JsonRpcException - when the id field in the response is empty or null.
        JsonRpcExceptoin - when result and error fields are both empty or null.
